elements.title: pulpit in the Pisa Baptistery
elements.contents: ... that the pulpit in the Pisa Baptistery (1260) by Nicola Pisano has a relief combining the Annunciation with the Nativity (pictured), with two Virgin Marys beside each other?

elements.title: Phyllis Boyens
elements.contents: ... that in 1977, Appalachian folk singer Phyllis Boyens performed at a Christmas benefit concert to support Kentucky coal miners who had been on strike for 17 months?

elements.title: Grandpa Indian
elements.contents: ... that Grandpa Indian, created in the 1930s to replace Santa Claus in Brazil, was portrayed as adorned in colorful bird feathers, bringing gifts to Brazilian children?

elements.title: Christmas horror
elements.contents: ... that an early example of the genre of Christmas horror is A Christmas Carol, published in 1843?

elements.title: Kurt S. Adler
elements.contents: ... that Jewish refugee Kurt S. Adler, who started one of the largest importers of Christmas decorations to the United States, was called "America’s Father Christmas" by the magazine German Life in 2002?

elements.title: stop motion animated Christmas special
elements.contents: ... that the live-action comedy series Community had a stop motion animated Christmas special?

elements.title: Verbum caro factum est
elements.contents: ... that "Verbum caro factum est", a Christmas motet for six voices by Hans Leo Hassler in the Venetian polychoral style, has been arranged for brass ensembles?

elements.title: Yule cat
elements.contents: ... that in Icelandic folklore, the Yule cat eats people who do not receive new clothing for Christmas?
